At Morgan, our purpose is to use advanced materials to help make more efficient use of the world’s resources and to improve the quality of life.

We know there are significant trends shaping our modern world. Resources are becoming more scarce and harder to access, our climate and environment is changing, and the pace of innovation and technology change is accelerating. Each of these, directly or indirectly puts more demand on materials.

Advanced materials have never been more important, and Morgan is leading the way in using materials to solve complex problems brought on by the demands of the modern world. If you are passionate about how you can support materials science, relish applying your knowledge to solve difficult problems and strive to delight customers, then come and join us.

Job Purpose
Create commercial strategies for product lines, clearly quantifying the value associated with each product
Provide technical support to the Customer Service team, Sales team and customers
Sell products to potential and existing customers face to face, achieving sales target
Keep up to date records of all sales related activity
Essential duties and responsibilities
Monitor technical trends
Study product information to develop professional knowledge
Identify and deliver presentations of products to potential customers
Advise customers on the use of products and answer technical questions
Understand and be able to explain to Customers and Colleagues the technical benefits and Distinctive Competencies of Morgan’s product compared to the competition
Deliver technical value to Morgan’s value proposition by working closely with the customer to help solve their technical / material problems
Work directly with the customer to plan, design, execute and deliver technical projects to solve the customer’s problems.
Work with and advise the Sales and Customer Service teams on product related queries for the greater business benefit.
Coordinate with site operations to ensure samples are delivered on time to new and existing customers.
Own and update a live Distinctive Competencies document that covers all of Morgan’s products within the market segment.
Deliver total solution and cross selling of all relevant Morgan products to all customers.
Feedback future customer needs to the CoE and technology teams to drive the technology roadmap.
The above is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required. Other duties may be assigned.

Founded in 2014 in London, United Kingdom, Garrison has raised more than $50m to date from London investors including Dawn Capital, IP Group, NM Capital and BGF. Garrison’s strengths lie in its experienced and dedicated teams, building on years of expertise in cyber security to bring genuinely game changing technology to the industry.

Garrison is working to build the future of cyber security and is already deploying at scale in both the government and commercial space. Our existing customers are large organisations averaging over 50,000 employees each, across sectors including banking, insurance, media, telco, law and government.

Our working culture

We are an exciting start-up with ground-breaking technology; a very serious mission to solve real world problems, but with a positive and highly inclusive atmosphere, and an excellent work/life balance!

At Garrison we celebrate diversity and inclusion, and we’re focused on continuously improving equality for the benefit of our employees, products and community. We recruit, develop and retain talent purely on the basis of qualifications, merit and business needs.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we take every possible step to ensure that every person employed or seeking employment with us receives fair treatment. No-one shall be disadvantaged on the grounds of age, disability, gender, ethnicity, religion or belief, sexual orientation, marital and parental status, neurodiversity, social background, physical ability, illness or otherwise.

Our employee benefits package is as follows:
Flexible working hours and regular working from home
25 days holiday allowance per year (with the opportunity to buy or sell up to 5 days)
Company pension scheme of 8% base salary (depends on employee minimum contribution)
Personal annual training budget
Life assurance and critical illness cover
Share option scheme
Perkbox discounts and freebies – free coffee, free cinema tickets, and lots more
Bike to work scheme and an interest-free season ticket loans
Regular socials – games nights, open air cinema, quiz nights & company picnic all recent!
And free fruit, tea and coffee in our offices!
Overview of the role

We are looking for an experienced application engineer to contribute to the development of our end-user application, the Garrison App. The Garrison App is a multi-platform (Windows, Linux, macOS, iOS and Android) application which enables users to access our secure remote browsing platform, delivering an interactive and highly usable browsing experience.

Within the team, you will help delivering new capabilities and improvements to our portfolio of high-quality and user-friendly applications, suitable for use by high-profile, global institutions. This is an opportunity to make the difference for an innovative and disruptive project which is unique and will transform cybersecurity.

You will be exposed to an advanced app architecture where the platform-specific layer wraps native (C++) multi-platform sub-modules accountable – amongst other things – for high-performance video/audio rendering, user interaction and low-level networking for authentication and streaming.

You will be involved in writing high-quality code at every level of the stack and responsible for delivering a delightful user experience. You will also help improving the CI infrastructure suitable for both testing application behaviour and catching regressions as soon as they appear.

You will also have the opportunity to provide technical leadership on projects and mentor other software engineers – experience in this area is beneficial but not essential.

2020/21 is shaping up to be our busiest and most productive year yet, with increasing demand, steady growth, and plenty of impactful projects taking place!

Product software development
Developing functionality for the product to meet the key market needs with a focus on delivering reliable, high-quality software solutions.
Contributing to the scoping and design of new software and supporting planning and estimating, including responsibility for estimating individual development tasks.
Integration, test and sustainment
Performing the end-to-end integration and test of software components and deploying them onto hardware through both manual testing and automated test development.
Interacting with local and remote teams on complex integrations.
Continuous improvement and innovation
Improving code maintainability, automation and supportability, e.g. code refactoring, code peer-review, unit test development and provision of stable APIs.
Suggesting and progressing opportunities for innovation across the product, investigating new technologies and techniques, performing prototyping with the direction of senior leadership, and discovering new opportunities for new design improvements and product features.
Skills and Experience

You’ll be perfect for the role if you have the following -
Experience in developing complex mobile and desktop applications, with native code components and interaction with backend services through REST APIs and low-level sockets / web sockets.
Development experience across one or more of our target platforms using C++, Objective-C/C++, Swift and Java/Kotlin.
Knowledge of end-to-end build and app publishing toolchains, particularly for mobile applications on iOS.
Demonstrable knowledge of core computer science concepts such as concurrency, networking, security, performance and algorithms.
Experience here would be a bonus (but don’t worry if you haven’t covered these, we will support your learning as required!):
Android NDK development with exposure to JNI.
Qt development.
Keen understanding of UI/UX.
JavaScript development.
Continuous Integration – including exposure to Gitlab pipelines and Docker/Kubernetes.
We are delighted to have team members who show the following qualities:
A passion for technology, demonstrated through previous project work, professional roles and/or personal projects. You’ll likely enjoy technical challenges and delivering results!
Self-motivated, flexible and adaptable, and can cope when thrown in at the deep end.
Will understand the importance of planning, prioritisation and getting work done on schedule.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills, plus the ability to effectively collaborate with others.

Freelancer.com is the world's largest freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace, which connects millions of employers to freelancers across the globe.

We are looking for full stack software engineers. Our team work with the latest tech, and push code 30-40 times a day in a high-performance cloud environment. We develop core, revenue-generating products, and so this represents an opportunity to have a fundamental impact on our global business.

Not only will you build features and software that scale, but your work will have direct impact on tens of millions of users worldwide. So if you excel at architecting web applications at scale, enjoy the challenge of writing optimised lightning fast SQL for massive data sets, have experience structuring extensible data and application logic, and are passionate about designing high quality APIs, then we'd love to hear from you!

Experience with Javascript, preferably Angular, TypeScript, ES6 or other common JS frameworks
Experience with relational databases and SQL, preferably MySQL
Linux experience
Background or interest in web engineering at scale
Ideally, a Github page with contributions to open source software
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science / Engineering (or related); MS or PhD a plus

This won’t be a cog-in-the-machine type of job; you will be joining a global company that values attitude and capability over experience, so if you are looking to make a difference and be rewarded for your efforts, this is the place for you.

We are striving to shape the future of work, so help us scale to 100+ million users, while enjoying all the perks of working in tech.

Job Title: Junior Operational Analytics Engineer

Reporting to: Operational Analytics Manager

Department: Technology – Operational Analytics

The Department:

Technology creates and innovates the software needed to run our global online B2C gaming operations, including systems for Customer Service, Marketing, CRM, brand website development, DWH/BI, web analytics and the supporting frameworks and tools for one of the largest global online gaming groups. Our dynamic environment is fast paced, using Agile and self-organizing principles for our teams to deliver the highest quality new products.

The Team:

The Operational Analytics team are responsible for running the data systems and services that monitor and report on the operational infrastructure. We are heavily dependent on Elasticsearch for our operational intelligence and are embracing Azure tools as the department migrates applications to the cloud.

Purpose of the role:

The purpose of the role is to support, maintain and enhance the tools used by the department to deliver services to users throughout the business. We currently use the Elastic stack extensively (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana, Beats) but have plans to investigate and deploy other tooling to meet business requirements.

This is an opportunity for a talented individual to become a part of a highly successful Operational Analytics team within a complex, demanding and fast paced online gaming environment. The Junior Operational Analytics Engineer will get exposure to and learn in a diverse eco system of data persistence technologies.

You’ll get exposure to Elasticsearch and many other key technologies that are deployed across on-premise and cloud based platforms running a mixture of Windows, Linux and Azure cloud based containers. The environment is one which actively encourages staff development and the implementation of new technologies and techniques.

You will be responsible for:

The position will involve the following areas of responsibility:
Perform daily checks of the operational systems, investigating and resolving issues where required
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues as they arise
Support the Logstash data pipelines for loading data into Elasticsearch
Answer ad-hoc information requests using Kibana/Timelion or other tools as appropriate
Maintain the packages used to collect data from web servers
This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of responsibilities. The job holder may be required to complete any other reasonable duties in order to achieve business objectives.

You will have:
Demonstrable experience of administrating data systems on either Windows or Linux
Demonstrable experience of querying data sources and/or data analysis
An eagerness to learn about data analysis in general and more specifically how this is implemented using the Elastic stack
It would be a bonus if you also had:
Knowledge or experience of using the Elastic stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana, Beats)
Knowledge or experience of using Microsoft Azure
Knowledge or experience of Linux (CentOS/Red Hat preferred) or Windows Server
An understanding of virtualisation (VMWare)
Any SQL Database knowledge (MS SQL Server preferred)
Some development knowledge including experience with common toolsets used such as Git, Chef, Azure Devops etc.
Person Specification:
Self-starter
Passionate about technology
Attention to detail
Be willing to learn new technologies
Comfortable working to tight deadlines
Patient and calm under pressure
Enjoy working with a team
Must be willing to do reasonable after-hours standby and support if required
Excellent communication skills - both to a technical and non-technical audience
Our Perks:
Flexible working
Competitive package
Great social and charity events
Health and well being weeks
Free fruit and a heavily discounted Barista
Tickets to events via sponsorships etc
Season Ticket Loan
Win Technologies (UK) Limited provides support services to Betway and is a proud member of the Betway Group

Bouygues E&S are seeking to appoint a Mechanical Engineer to support our Energy from Waste facility in Hoddesdon.

Role Purpose:
To support the Engineering Manager in the management, supervision, planning and co-ordination of the Mechanical maintenance team in order to deliver maximum plant reliability, flexibility, availability and overall plant performance in line with high standards of Safety, Quality and Environmental performance.
This plant utilises Gasification Technology, combined with a Steam Turbine, to generate ~10MW which is enough to power around 14,500 homes. As an Energy from Waste plant using Refuse Derived Fuel, the plant will also be reducing approximately 180,000 Tonnes of waste from heading to a landfill on an annual basis.

Duties:
,- Performance of designated Safe System of Work responsibilities as defined by the Bouygues EfW Safety Rules.
,- Active participation in site Safety forums, including procedure and Safety System reviews on a periodic basis.
,- Assisting in the development and implementation of the site Computerized Maintenance Management System.
,- Day to day management, supervision, planning, and co-ordination of departmental activities to deliver maximum plant availability, flexibility and overall performance.
,- Development and delivery of maintenance techniques and procedures directed at increasing overall plant availability and performance.
,- Performance of troubleshooting, routine, scheduled and major repair maintenance on all site mechanical, pneumatic and hydraulic systems.
,- Quality control of all work associated with Departmental activities on site, including supervision and control of sub contractor works as required.
,- Provision of close technical support to Operations and other site teams.
,- Develop and maintain effective interfaces between the maintenance department and all other site functional teams.
,- Quality control of all work associated with Departmental activities on site, including supervision and control of sub contractor works as required.
,- Manage the implementation of modifications and site improvement projects.
,- Supporting outage planning, co-ordination and management.

Desirable & Essential Criteria:

Essential:
page: 2 of 3
,- HNC / HND in a Mechanical Engineering discipline. (Qualifications below this level may be acceptable if accompanied by suitable experience)
,- Comprehensive, practical experience in the preventative maintenance and defect repair/interrogation on process related mechanical equipment.
,- Full understanding of P&IDs and mechanical drawings, and the ability to read hydraulic, pneumatic and isometric diagrams.
,- A flexible approach to out of hours call out, and changes to working patterns where necessary to the needs of the business.
,- Willingness to work towards multi-skilling.
,- Experience of working in a technically challenging environment.
,- Flexible and performance driven, with the commitment, determination and resilience to deliver added value to operational performance.
,- The ability to communicate and influence effectively, and work collaboratively, at all levels.

Desirable:
,- NEBOSH or IOSH qualification.
,- Knowledge and experience of PSSR and LOLER certification.
,- Knowledge and experience of Electricity Supply Industry standard Safe Systems of work, Safety Rules and Permit for Work Systems.
,- Knowledge and understanding of Health, Safety and Environmental legislation relevant to steam powered electricity generation.
,- Knowledge and experience in the operation and/or maintenance of steam powered electricity generation equipment.

Time Electronics is seeking an application engineer with calibration and instrumentation experience. Primarily working from our factory based in Tonbridge, Kent the position also offers global travel opportunities.
Sales*
The role will include working with UK and global customers, as well as maintaining and establishing international distribution channels. A technical understanding of calibration and metrology is needed to assess customer needs, and to provide technical and commercial proposals. Large scale project work is performed as part of a team to configure and design multi-purpose calibration systems and turnkey testing facilities.
Technical Support*
The successful applicant will require the ability to provide pre-sales and after-sales technical support. A strong understanding of technical literature with the capability to write application and service documentation is needed.
Customer Training*
Ongoing tasks will include performing product specific and generalised customer training in calibration methods, process control and electrical instrumentation. The ability to learn and understand software driven applications for testing purposes is necessary.
Travel*
The successful candidate will be expected to travel overseas for sales activities and provide training for our extensive global network of customers.
Opportunity*
This is an excellent career opportunity for an ambitious and dynamic sales and application engineer to join a fast growing business that manufactures a wide range of testing systems. The role is diverse and ideal for someone who likes to travel and work with an international customer base. It is a chance to be part of a team and work on exciting global projects that provide customers with advanced solutions to help improve quality and control in their respective industries.
Desired Skills and Experience*
Multi-parameter calibration knowledge, primarily electrical, pressure, temperature.
Process control.
Electronics and service work.
Electro-mechanical engineering.
Computer maintenance.
An understanding of software driven calibration, calibration management using software.
Perform calibration training.
Perform calibration system installations.
Sales experience, maintaining a customer database and customer relations.
Perform sales presentations.
Technical support capabilities.
Keen to travel internationally performing training, installation and service work.
Strong communication skills.
Know how to use software: MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint.
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £30,000.00-£45,000.00 per year

WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a variety of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality trading signals (Alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ trading strategies focused on exploiting market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of Alphas and financial strategies the foundation of a sustainable, global trading platform.

Technologists at WorldQuant research, design, code, test and deploy projects while working collaboratively with researchers and portfolio managers. Our environment is relaxed yet intellectually intense. Our teams are lean and agile, which means rapid prototyping of products with immediate user feedback. We seek people who think in code, aspire to solve undiscovered computer science challenges and are motivated by being around like-minded people. In fact, of the 600 employees globally, approximately 500 of them code on a daily basis.

WorldQuants success is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Great ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess a mindset of continuous improvement. Thats a key ingredient in remaining a leader in any industry. Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest engineers. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an exceptional talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us create it. Our collective intelligence will drive us there.

The Role: WorldQuant is seeking an exceptional individual to lead the design and implementation of large-scale, complex software systems. The candidate is expected to work closely across teams within WorldQuant as a hands-on leader. A successful candidate will possess an in-depth knowledge of design patterns, software architecture and design principles and how to implement them. The candidate should be familiar with common technologies used in distributed systems as well the design and use of database systems.

The candidate must have a solid understanding of the agile development process pipeline, systems thinking, and modern software development methods. Most importantly, the candidate must be pro-active and adapt quickly to changes in business needs and have strong ability to balance short term wins and long term architecture needs.

What Youll Bring:

Degree in a quantitative or technical discipline from a top tier institution
5+ years of experience as a developer with experience in developing distributed systems; demonstrated experience mentoring and guiding junior members of the team
Proven track record of leading fast paced, complex projects, and providing technical leadership to other software developers within and across the organization
Demonstrated ability to program in Python (working knowledge of Numpy, Pandas, Django and Asyncio) and developing cluster-based applications on Linux/Unix platforms
Working knowledge in various distributed technologies such as Redis, Kafka, ZooKeeper, Cassandra etc.
Possess a strong mathematical background to better understand the quantitative environment and more effectively translate business requirements into software solutions
Strong familiarity with Kubernetes, as well as batch job scheduling systems a big plus
Experience of effectively leveraging database technologies in distributed software systems
Motivated by the transformational effects of technology-at-scale, as well as direct, measurable business results
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Excellent problem solving abilities and judgment with strong attention to detail
Mature and thoughtful, with the ability to operate in a collaborative, team-oriented culture

A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK’s biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers.

Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped.

Jagex is expanding and extending its portfolio with fresh franchise titles, new IP and, in 2018 launched Jagex Partners, delivering third-party publishing and operational services exclusively for the living games of the future.

Jagex employs more than 400 people at its Cambridge headquarters and is on the hunt for talented people to work across the business to help the company to achieve yet another year of record growth and player satisfaction.

Brief Description

Salary: £31,305 to £37,028 (Inclusive of role based allowances)
Band: UKRI D
Contract Type: Open-Ended
Hours: Full time or Part time (minimum 25 hours per week)
Closing Date: 29th November 2020

STFC reserve the right to conduct interviews for/close this vacancy early if a sufficient number of applicants are received.

About Us

At the Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC), one of Europe’s largest multidisciplinary research organisations, the expertise of our computing staff is key to making our research happen. Consequently, we are committed to developing our staff, and training will be provided in relevant areas. We work with the very latest technologies to drive advances in both hardware and software that have genuine real-world applications. Whether it is the search for the Higgs Boson and dark matter, analysing climate data or genomics, our systems tackle the biggest and most challenging problems in scientific computing.

STFC’s Scientific Computing Department (SCD) develops leading edge software, compute and data storage infrastructures, to support the work of world class science both within STFC and internationally.

About the Role

We now have new opportunities for passionate software engineers in SCD (http://www.stfc.ac.uk/SCD), offering an excellent opportunity for career development and an exceptional benefits package.

The department develops and maintains software to support the computing and data requirements of international scientific experiments. We use a wide range of technologies such as Python, React, SQL, C, RESTful web services, Linux and OpenStack.

In this role as a Software Engineer you will:
Use agile tools and techniques to play a full part in all aspects of the software development lifecycle
Propose sound solutions that consider both technical and human factors to guide our development of software systems
Be involved in supporting new and existing systems
Use state-of-the-art tools to deploy and configure our solutions.
We do our best to use the right tool for the job. This means you get to develop your expertise in a wide range of server and client-side technologies, and you will research and make recommendations on what tools or technologies we should use when embarking on a project.

As part of UK Research and Innovation, STFC offers a working environment and benefits package designed to provide an excellent work/life balance. For this opportunity, we welcome applications on a full-time, part-time (minimum 25 hours) or term-time only basis and we also offer a flexible working scheme. Further benefits include 30 days’ (pro rata) annual leave, 10.5 public and privilege days, Christmas shut down, a workplace nursery, an exceptional defined benefit pension scheme, and social and sporting activities and societies. STFC is an open and inclusive work environment, committed to promoting equality, diversity and inclusion.

You may be required to undertake occasional UK and Overseas travel and to take a routine share in an on-call work system providing out of hours cover (allowance and overtime payments provided).

Organization Description

UK Research and Innovation is a new entity that brings together nine partners to create an independent organisation with a strong voice for research and innovation, and a vision to ensure the UK maintains its world-leading position in research and innovation. More information can be found at www.ukri.org.

The Science and Technology Facilities Council is a world-leading multi-disciplinary science organisation, and our goal is to deliver economic, societal, scientific and international benefits to the UK and its people – and more broadly to the world.

Company Description

Kinetica helps many of the world’s largest companies solve some of the world’s most complex problems, including Citibank, GSK, OVO, Softbank, and Telkomsel, among others. The Kinetica Streaming Data Warehouse combines historical and streaming data analysis with powerful location intelligence and AI in a single platform, all easily accessible via API and SQL, for instant results. Organizations across automotive, energy, telecommunications, retail, healthcare, financial services, and beyond can load and analyze their entire collection of data simultaneously, delivering instant insight. Kinetica has a rich partner ecosystem, including Dell, HP, IBM, NVIDIA, and Oracle, and is privately held, backed by leading global venture capital firms Canvas Ventures, Citi Ventures, GreatPoint Ventures, and Meritech Capital Partners.

For more information and to try Kinetica, visit kinetica.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

Job Description

Solutions Engineers are responsible for articulating and demonstrating how Kinetica can solve the hardest analytics problems. Interfacing directly with customers they are the ambassadors for the company and the technology. The team is composed of data engineers, data scientists, and entrepreneurs. You will work closely with all aspects of product, delivery, and sales to play a pivotal role in winning new customers, growing existing accounts, and driving company growth. You will be a trusted advisor, product expert, and visionary to a variety of users across all verticals.

We are seeking a hands-on customer-facing and hands-on Technical Solutions Engineer to lead the charge on the front lines of an exciting and disruptive, proven technology. Partner with Enterprise customers to help them power their businesses using data by designing, developing, and deploying Big Data, AI & Analytics solutions on the world's fastest GPU accelerated OLAP database.

Responsibilities:
Engage with sales prospects where you prepare and present Kinetica’s technology along with addressing any technical questions that come up during the sales cycle
Support the technical needs of existing customers including discovering additional use cases for Kinetica’s technology
Work closely with the product management and engineering team to align customer requirements to future versions and products
Have a deep understanding of Kinetica’s technology and a willingness to learn new technologies when needed
Qualifications
Technical Degree (i.e. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology)
4+ years of pre-sales experience
Strong programming skills in any of the following languages: Java, Python or C++
Experience with Linux and SQL skills are a mandatory requirement.
Strong understanding of Big Data, Data Warehouse, Data structures, Algorithms, and designing highly available systems. Ability to design & articulate enterprise architecture
Knowledgeable of and has a strong concept on databases, data warehousing, OLAP, data architecture, and data engineering
Has an experience working with MPP database and big data system (Hadoop)
Knowledge of enterprise systems and protocols is a plus. Ex: LDAP, SSO, SSL, BI applications.
Experience with Machine Learning, Neural Networks is a plus
Knowledge in Geospatial formulas and techniques is a plus
Experience working in a start-up an environment
Travel (post-covid)
Soft Skills:
Great communication skills (verbal and written)
High-energy self-starter with a passion for data, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment with limited direction

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Title: Application Support Engineer (Mobile App and Saas Solution)
Job Description:
About the Company: *
Freespace by Workplace Fabric is a rapidly growing technology company to create the most efficient and effective working environments. Using patented sensor technology, mobile apps, data analytics and innovative displays Freespace helps office users get the best out of their workspace while enabling a business to fully understand the utilisation of an office building. Most of our clients are seeing how >20% savings can be achieved as well as creating a much-improved working environment for staff and reduced service cost. The business has implemented the solution in more than 70 cities around the world with major blue-chip companies as clients. With businesses looking to move to hybrid working post-Covid, technology from Freespace is becoming an instrument for enabling safe return and a must have tool for evolving a future workplace.
About the Application Engineer Role: *
Due to rapid growth and exciting return to work products development, the opportunity has arisen for an Application engineer to support the implementation of our exciting solutions with large multi-national blue-chip clients. As Application engineer, you will work within the customer facing team providing support to clients that are deploying the solutions across their offices.
Key Deliverables of the Role: *
Pre-sales and Mobilisation Support

• Become established “expert” in selected Freespace applications supporting sales team with deep knowledge about implementation and delivery of these solutions

• Provide technical expertise for all questions arising during the mobilisation process. Respond to questions arising from different client stakeholders with corresponding technical responses.

• Assist with selection and customisation of various Freespace solutions and their options to deliver desired client outcomes

Troubleshooting

• Responsible for identifying trends and potential problem sources and deciding if necessary, to escalate to the Development Team during and after mobilisation.

• Responsible for application delivery support, investigating queries, replicating issues and liaising with product team if necessary, to ensure problems are resolved.

• Determine the root cause of a client issues and thoroughly document resolutions and workarounds as Knowledge Based articles.

Applications Development

• Act as a primary interface with the Development Team on any escalations from client users and own the resolution path for detailed technical solutions to issues

• Develop and regularly maintain a great general knowledge of all Freespace products to help define new ways of customising solutions to address client needs

• Liaise and partner with Product teams and fellow applications team members from across the company to ensure knowledge sharing and best practice development

• Participate in continuous improvement reviews to evaluate the process and identify areas for development.
Nature, Skills & Qualifications*
• Demonstrated curiosity to tinker, troubleshoot, research, understand and solve

• A keen solution mindset that helps users achieve the best out of a product feature

• Clarity of thinking and an ability to explain complex logic and reasoning in simple language

• Strong tech skills in areas such as networking, connectivity, wireless systems, software or Saas

• Convincing and confident with technical knowledge, yet humble and inclusive in getting buy in from clients and partners

• Interested in growing into a Technical Sales role.

• Degree level or equivalent education within IT, Business Systems or some other technical related field.

• Experience in Workplace Software, HRMS, CAFM or IWMS systems in an applications role

• Previous experience providing 2nd or 3rd line software or Saas deployment support with a strong ability to contribute at a technical level

• MSc, MEng, MCSA (or equivalent)

FXGO is a world-class trading platform that allows traders to buy and sell currencies (FX) 24/5. The FX market is the largest market in the world, with more than $6 trillion traded every day— and our platform is used by the industry's biggest players in over 120 countries. Our trading applications are distributed, fault-tolerant, highly transactional and low-latency.

Our team:

FXGO is a growing team of talented engineers who are passionate about our product. We take pride in building one of the premier FX trading platforms in the world! In London, we are expanding in Shared Services and the FX Trading Grid application.

Shared Services comprises Enablements, Post Trade and the Regulatory Reporting and Clearing teams. All 3 teams are service oriented, focusing on delivering highly available, low latency and highly adaptable services to front end trading applications across FXGO and beyond. Together, they form the lower layer of the FXGO trading platform. The teams own software across the stack but with more focus on the backend.

The FX Trading Grid application allows traders to buy and sell currencies at the click of a button. The application has to process large amount of continuous real-time data and process trade execution as fast as possible. The engineers are client facing and implement workflows for the front end as equally as low latency-scalable solutions for the back end.

Who are you?

An engineer who is motivated by building and adding value to financial products that are used by clients, and who appreciates the impact of your work. You are someone who always takes ownership of what you're doing, and you're excited by the opportunity to work on problems that range from engineering to business logic to usability. You love to see what you build in the hands of clients and the challenge of building a live real-time trading platform energizes you.

You'll need to have:
Strong problem solving skills
Solid C++ or related OOP programming skills
Exposure to all phases of software development life cycle
Appetite to understand and appreciate complex systems
Passion to drive technology and product evolution
We'd love to see:
Experience with high volume, high availability distributed systems.
Experience with messaging queues
Good working knowledge of databases
Experience with distributed cache technologies
Interview process

We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background, but the general framework can be found here:https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/technology/engineering/software-engineering-experienced-hire

We have a lot of opportunities to choose from in Engineering, and it is important to us that your skills and experience align best with the team you are interviewing with. To help ensure you are placed on the right team, your application will be considered for all of our current vacancies in Engineering at the first stage of the interview process.

Dubbed an "open-source unicorn" by Forbes, Confluent is the fastest-growing enterprise subscription company our investors have ever seen. And how are we growing so fast? By pioneering a new technology category with an event streaming platform, which enables companies to leverage their data as a continually updating stream of events, not as static snapshots. This innovation has led Coatue Management, Altimeter Capital and Franklin Templeton to join earlier investors Sequoia Capital, Benchmark, and Index Ventures in the recent Series E financing of a combined $250 million at a $4.5B valuation. Our product has been adopted by Fortune 100 customers across all industries, and we’re being led by the best in the space—our founders were the original creators of Apache Kafka®. We’re looking for talented and amazing team players who want to accelerate our growth, while doing some of the best work of their careers. Join us as we build the next transformative technology platform!

Technical Support Engineers work at the intersection of our client services and engineering teams and drive customer success by helping identify and resolve critical business issues. In this role you’ll interact directly with our customers to provide software development and operations expertise, leveraging deep knowledge of best practices in the use of Apache Kafka, the broader Confluent Platform, as well as complementary systems. You will be hands on in fixing issues seen by Confluent customers and contributing fixes back to the open source community. Throughout all of these interactions, you’ll build strong relationships with customers, ensuring exemplary support and timely resolution to customer requests.
A typical week at Confluent in this role may involve..
Working with customers to resolve a wide range of issues with their Confluent deployments
Contributing to process development - we’re a small team, so we’re looking for people who want to help us lay the foundation for growing efficiently and with a best-in-class culture
Communicating with our core engineering team to provide real-time product feedback from the field
Improving product documentation and authoring knowledge base articles
Creating and reviewing product demos and internal tooling
Working closely with the team behind Apache Kafka!
Required Skills and Experience:
Excitement in learning about streaming data and becoming a domain expert in Apache Kafka
Experience in diagnosing, reproducing, and resolving customer issues
Desire to make customers successful through direct interaction

Two out of these three:
Experience troubleshooting applications running on Linux (resource contention, network bottlenecks, etc.)
Operational knowledge of Java applications (jstack,jmap, etc.)
Experience with at least one mainstream distributed system (e.g. Kafka, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.)
Culture is a huge part of Confluent, we’re searching for the best people who not only excel at their role, but also contribute to the health, happiness and growth of the company. Inclusivity and openness are important traits, with regular company wide and team events. We are looking for people who are:
Smart, humble and empathetic
Hard working, inquisitive and not afraid to ask all the questions, no matter how basic
Always striving for excellence in their work, their team, and their company

Job Description

Role Overview

The Unified Communications Applications Engineer is responsible for development, operations, maintenance, support, and documentation of the engineering and operations that sit behind our global Unified Communications services, which include Microsoft Teams and Skype for Business (with our Cloud Voice calling plans), Cisco Webex calling and collaboration, hybrid voice solutions (connecting on-premises voice platforms to our Cloud Voice services), and additional communication related applications such as cloud recording of voice, video and collaboration, and cloud contact center.

Key Responsibilities

Activities include designing and documenting the deployment and operational processes required to build and operate robust cloud communications products, through the project lifecycle; tier 3 escalation support for UC platforms and applications; and participating in customer onboarding and integration projects, leveraging expert technical understanding and troubleshooting skills throughout the application stack. The role may also involve consultation and development of custom configurations and/or software solutions. Specifically, the engineer may assist or lead the evaluation, adaptation, and integration of existing internal or third party (software and hardware) systems to support NTT’s developing communications portfolio, and will be part of the team which maintains the platforms, keeping them up to date from a technology and security perspective.

Key to Success
Provide guidance and leadership during design, build, and run activities to ensure success from lab to released solutions
Lead pre-production and production deployment, configuration, testing while ensuring best practices are followed and recommendations communicated.
Provide detailed technical documentation including solution high/low level design, platform build/configuration, troubleshooting, and operational procedures.
Maintain regional hours support by fielding technical calls from regional UC business and support teams.
Take a lead technical role in escalations with vendors
Maintain part of an on-call rotation to provide 24X7/365 support to global UC operations
Develop and maintain internal training and technical procedures for other NTT teams.
Provide support to the Project Management teams in regards to UC deployment and integration for customer onboarding and integration.
Qualifications

Professional / Technical Skills desired
Minimum 5 years’ experience in IT industry, as Senior System engineer in a Microsoft UC environment, preferably in a service provider or systems integrator environment
Experience working on a cross functional team including architecture and design as well as operations and support.
Strong experience Microsoft UC solutions (Teams, Skype for Business, Lync Server) in an engineering, implementation or support role
Experience in Cisco UC solutions (CUCM, Webex) in an engineering, implementation or support role a distinct advantage
Implementation, support or engineering experience with SIP voip technologies preferably including experience with Audiocodes, Cisco, Ribbon or Oracle SBC platforms.
Experience in operating solutions in Microsoft Azure a distinct advantage
Technical skills: ability to author and present information and provide advice to stakeholders on relevant technologies
Experienced with administration of: Office 365, Teams, Windows Server, Skype for Business/Lync, and other Microsoft server and desktop technologies.
Good working knowledge of: TCP/IP networking technology (switch, router, firewall), Reverse Proxy, Load balancers. Knowledge of virtualization, and SAN solution beneficial
Experience in troubleshooting of voip systems, SIP telephony, and Carrier or PBX interoperability
Microsoft Certified IT Professional in related technologies.
Soft Skills desired
Ability to communicate best practices, settings & configuration. Hands-on experience with relevant technologies is required.
Ability to make decisions and recommendations relating to technology or design choices, for example functionality, performance, scalability, manageability.
Excellent written & oral communication, prioritizing, and relationship building skills
Adaptation skills: ability to manage unexpected and complex situations & proactively propose contingency plans;
Proven problem solving, analysis, planning, and time management skills
Independent self-starter and quick learner who is able to work well under pressure and tight timelines
Fluent English speaking and writing is mandatory.

At Freetrade, we believe investing should be open to everyone. It's one of the best ways to grow your savings, but for a lot of people, investing seems complicated, expensive and remote. We want to change all that!

We're a technology company that brings simple, free stock investing to everyone. We've built a beautiful investing app to trade in real shares, with zero commissions or fees in a fluid, mobile-first experience.

As the first challenger stockbroker to disrupt the £1.2 trillion UK retail investment market, we're poised to expand into Europe in 2020. With a Series A funding round led by Draper Esprit and our recent crowdfunding round in which we raised £7m, our total funding exceeds £24m.

Our team is growing fast, and now we're looking for a mid-level mobile oriented Software Engineer to join us.

Our stack:

Using GCP's serverless offerings like Firestore, Cloud Composer & Stackdriver, we're able to quickly build a reliable and performant platform. We use Swift and Kotlin to write performant and reliable native applications leading to a frictionless investment experience.

You love to learn new skills and want to develop your existing ones to maximise your potential

Write well-tested software
Support operational excellence

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

A Software Applications Engineer is required for our established R&D and manufacturing site at Towcester, Northamptonshire.

Key Responsibilities

You will provide software and hardware support to the process engineering team based at the Caswell site. Hardware interfacing will be undertaken with the support of the equipment engineering team.

Develop and maintain:
Support the maintenance of in-house manufacturing GUI’s, e.g. Equipment Tracker.
Tools to analyse and predict process drift
Tools to manage and report SPC metrics
Tools to allow visualisation of the site’s KPI performance
Tools analyse wafer fab work flows and WiP statistics

Skills/Competences
Knowledge of hardware interfacing (networking, DI/O, ADC).

Knowledge of Object Orientated programming, primarily C#.
Experience of working in a team and managing stakeholders.
Have good time-management and organizational skills.

Knowledge of programming for MS office would be an advantage, e.g. VBA for Excel, Access
Knowledge of Web Services (e.g. Tomcat, Apache), and Web Development (e.g. ASP.NET) desirable.
Knowledge of manufacturing execution systems (MES) such as PROMIS would be an advantage, though full training will be provided.

Qualifications
An HNC or Degree in a software discipline and/or 2 years of directly related experience.

Operationally
You will spend time working within a cleanroom environment and must be comfortable with the use of cleanroom clothing.
Self-motivated and dependable with good communication skills.
Ability to work efficiently under pressure, alone or as a part of a team.
Excellent attendance, timekeeping and punctuality.
Must have a professional attitude to work and to colleagues.
A flexible approach to work and customer demand.
Candidates must be eligible to work in the UK

This is a days-based role (37.5 hrs, nominally 9-5 Mon-Fri). This role would also be suitable for a recent graduate in software engineering with knowledge of hardware interfacing.

We offer a competitive salary, Bonus, Pension, Private medical, Health cash plan, relocation allowance if appropriate, and other benefits.

Who are we?

We want to help small business win. That’s why we’re here.

We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, help families and power economies – because we believe that people are made to do more. And we want to help them.

So, we created the leading online marketplace for small business loans. Our investors have lent £9.8 billion in 130,000 loans to 90,000 small business owners. In a single year, we unlocked 115,000 jobs and contributed £6.5 billion to the global economy. There’s never been a better time to join!

Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.

This role sits within the “Tech and Data” teams. The drivers behind our platform – brilliant people working together to create, code, and build the next game changers.

What will you be doing?

The driving force behind the world’s leading platform for small business lending is our engineering team. We are a diverse group from more than 25 different countries and cultures who bring together a wide range of backgrounds and experience (from music to aerospace engineering).

We are focused entirely on using technology to provide the best experience for our borrowers and investors. We are doing this by building elegant, sustainable, and scalable solutions that can be applied globally. We work in small agile teams practicing continuous integration, TDD and are no strangers to pairing as we believe that working together is smarter than sitting in silos.

Day to Day, this role will include:

Building up the strategy and the roadmap for our frontend experience from a technical perspective
Collaborate with the other lead engineers to define the long term tech strategy for our platform
Helping the engineering teams come up with solutions and designs that meet our architecture requirements and needs
Working side by side with the teams to iterate quickly when needed and meet commercial targets
UI design experimentation
Using Javascript (React) and Ruby Currently and built entirely on AWS
Mentoring more junior frontend engineers within the team

Are You

This role requires someone who has:

Strong experience in Front End engineering and JavaScript language fundamentals
Hands on experience with React in a senior engineer role is key for this position
Knowledge of other languages and paradigms is a plus
Strong fundamental programming skills (data structures, algorithms)
Good understanding of distributed systems and architectures
Familiarity developing on Unix/Linux
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken
Knowledge of Agile, Scrum, BDD, TDD and CI/CD
Proven experience mentoring/leading less experienced engineers

Why should you join us?

We’re gearing up for our biggest chapter yet – and it’s being driven by tech.

That means full steam ahead working on our global platform and real challenges for you to noodle and solve – as we build new things, reimagine the stack and go after the greenfield.

We believe that great ideas come from everywhere. So, there are no pigeonholes here. We keep it agile and open. Think big remits and huge ownership in a continuous learning environment. Close knit teams, with mentorships and global career opportunities. Everyone working together to make a genuine difference to small business owners, to us and to you.

Join the team making it happen. Help us define long-term commitments and launch the next game changers – let’s build the incredible.

It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.

At Funding Circle, we celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe that diversity makes us better. We particularly encourage applications from applicants from underrepresented backgrounds. We welcome applicants who may want to work flexibly.

Want to Build the Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.

Ordnance Survey (OS) provides national mapping services for Great Britain and is world-leading provider of geospatial solutions.

OS location data and expertise has helped governments make smarter decisions, businesses gain valuable data insight, and everyone experience the world outside for over 225 years.

Our growing Technology and Design team plays a key role in ensuring OS is at the cutting edge of geospatial capability and is looking for people to join them. Its mission is to work across the business to provide customer centric design and technology services.

Join us and you’ll have an opportunity to make an impact. To empower projects that deliver real-world benefits across Britain and internationally. To hear our customers say they couldn’t have done it without us. And to be central to OS’s vision: to be recognised as world leaders in geospatial services; creating location insight for positive impact.

About the role

A fantastic opportunity to influence and shape our maintenance roadmaps by providing continuous improvement to our existing systems. You will provide technical support to ensure our systems remain secure, supported, updated and meet business requirements in line with our strategic objectives.

You will have the opportunity to apply your experience in software engineering, support and maintenance to help us create secure, scalable, performant systems that are easy to maintain and support. Experience around Deployment, Debugging, Testing, Scaling and Monitoring modern cloud-based systems will be beneficial.

This is a varied role and as such we are seeking a candidate has exposure to engineering tools and best practices. You will provide expert technical consultancy and proactively safeguard the business, investigate failures and have the ability to make relevant changes.

Providing technical support and driving continuous improvement

Programming language - C# or Python

Oracle SQL

Software engineering best practice

Microsoft Azure technologies, Ruby and experience using Geospatial technologies (ESRI, FME) - desirable

The rewards

We want you to love what you do. That’s why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:

Salary: £36,414 - £40,698

Performance related bonus

A competitive pension scheme

37 hour working week (with flexible working options)

25 days annual leave - (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 over Christmas

Plus, a suite of excellent additional benefits

Location:

Home working from any location in the UK, with the expectation to visit the office when required (advance notice and expenses will be provided).

We recognise that Ordnance Survey’s ambition to continue attracting and retaining the most talented individuals means providing flexibility where possible, which is why we’re keen to hear from suitable candidates wherever you’re based in the UK. We embrace flexible working and as such, this role can be based from your home.

It doesn’t matter where you live, what matters is that you have the right skills and capabilities and understand what we’re trying to achieve at OS. We’ll ensure you have the tools, materials and equipment to be the best you can be, whilst being well connected to the rest of your team to drive collaboration. Technical Applications Support Engineer (L2)
Technical Operations
London

Full time

Making payments accessible to all

Thunes Global platform provides a seamless transfer of funds between payment systems in more than 100 countries and in 60 currencies.

We enable mobile wallet providers, platforms, PSPs, money transfer operators and banks to make ﬁnancial services accessible worldwide. Since Thunes was established in 2016, we have facilitated real-time transactions for millions of people and businesses across the world.

Overview

After securing exceptional investment following successful Series-B funding, Thunes is looking to grow and develop our global teams including the addition of a Technical Applications Support Engineer in our London team.

Reporting to the Technical Support Manager, the Technical Applications Support Engineer is responsible for handling escalations from Level 1 agents on a global scale of operations. The role will be working closely in responding and resolving customer complaints involving deeper investigations on the root cause of issues and be able to suggest changes in order to improve system performance or processes.

The role day to day:

We love to work with people who are passionate about the FinTech industry, clearly enjoy supporting partners and want to not only work in but help shape a disruptive, fast-growing and exciting environment.
Troubleshoots and responds to customer issues and provide timely updates and resolutions to customers according to SLA processes
Investigates application errors and escalates critical issues to relevant parties until service restoration
Monitors systems and applications by reacting to system alerts
Diagnoses issues using log files and other relevant tools
Works alongside other L2 engineers globally to form a follow-the-sun support model
Works closely with cross functional teams to support operational processes
Proactively conducts investigations on improving the Quality of Service we provide to customers
Works with external partners to resolve issues affecting service quality
Identifies potential issues and suggest corrective actions
Provides excellent customer experience and ensure that resolution is provided to every issue
Participates in on-duty rotation during weekends and public holidays when needed
The traits that make you stand out:
Be customer facing – you will have a close relationship with our partners and business development teams to expand our coverage and services
A collaborative approach - support internal teams with operational processes and new solutions
A solution focused, continuous improvement mindset
The ability to be independent and proactive - willing to get things done
What we are looking for:
Experience of providing hands on Applications Support in a client facing environment with strong troubleshooting, analytical & diagnostic skills
Prior experience working in terminal/SHH in a Linux environment
A demonstrable ability to read & understand log files
The ability to work effectively, multi-task, in an agile environment and take responsibility in challenging situations
Proven experience of using tools including Kibana, Grafana & Prometheus
A keen desire to learn and develop new skills and styles of working
Though not essential previous experience within technical operations for companies in Banking, Finance &/or Payments is advantageous

About us

At MarketFinance, we celebrate ambitious business leaders. They bring strength to our economy and are building the world we all want to live in. MarketFinance is one of the UK's leading Fintechs and we use smart technology, backed by help from great people, to deliver flexible business finance solutions, directly and quickly. Our online platform and proprietary risk model enable us to provide business loans and advance cash against outstanding invoices, in the form of working capital funding, so that businesses can get on with growing - instead of having to worry about cash flow. We believe in the endless possibilities that arise when entrepreneurs have more time to focus on what they love.

Our values matter and as part of the team, they’ll be yours too.

#MakeItHappen | #1Team1Dream | #AlwaysBeLearning

The Role

You will be working in autonomous teams that have the freedom to drive innovation themselves. We have a strong DevOps culture too and believe CI/CD/Testing are the only ways to innovate at scale. You will add value right away with coding, building, testing, deploying, monitoring.

This role will provide you with the opportunity to work with a small team of great engineers, working alongside a product manager to prioritise and deliver work.

Your Technical Environment

You’ll be working on our core platform allowing small business to access funding seamlessly through fantastic UX and automation of complex processing such as risk analysis and payment processing.

Pretty much all of our software at MarketFinance (including the application forms, trading infrastructure and payments gateway) has been developed in-house. We recently decided to move to serverless architecture as standard, but our core platform is built in .Net C# WebAPI and ReactJS and the choice of technologies is continually evolving.

Requirements
Experience working with C# and .NET technologies
WebAPI (1 & 2) and Entity Framework
Experience with Javascript frameworks such as Angular, Vue or React (Redux).
Experience with cloud platforms, ideally Azure.
SQL Server / SQL Azure.
Unit / Integration / Acceptance / Regression testing. We generally use NUnit, Jest and Cypress.
An interest in learning new languages and platforms.
Team ethic. You make change happen by working with & through others.
“Can do” attitude - when faced with a business or technical obstacle you will not run and hide. You should be able to describe the issues you’ve encountered, your approach to solving them and your final solution.
Finance/FinTech experience is beneficial, but not necessary.
Benefits

We are a team of bright and talented people from different backgrounds and cultures, with different perspectives, skills and experiences, who work together to get things done. Positivity is key which means we support each other and have a lot of fun along the way. Our celebration of small businesses binds us together and keeps us focused on our ultimate purpose. Whether this celebration comes from working in small businesses previously, having founded a business or having experienced it through family we all have this unique appreciation and it drives us to be the best for our customers.

At MarketFinance, the opportunity for growth is as big as your ambition. Things move quickly in FinTech and that’s all part of the adventure. Our benefits include:
Competitive salary and best-in-class share options scheme
25 days annual leave, plus your birthday off
Mentoring from industry leaders and the opportunity to make an impact at one of Europe’s foremost Fintechs
Private health coverage and half-price Virgin Active gym membership
Enhanced maternity leave, Amazon Kindle and unlimited e-books
Excellent company culture and a great office in the heart of Shoreditch
Ready to help UK businesses build the future? APPLY NOW!

We do our best to reply to all applications. However if you have not had a response within 4 weeks, please assume your application has not been successful.

How will we use the information about you?

We will use your data to process your application, to allow us to assess your suitability for a role and improve our sites. We may share your data with third parties to achieve these purposes. We will not share your data for marketing purposes.

We will keep your data safe in accordance with data protection legislation.

ABOUT US

Our purpose is to create outstanding places where people can thrive.

A consistent focus on people and culture has meant we've been feted 11 years in a row as one of The Sunday Times' "100 Best Small Companies to Work For" – a standout achievement in our sector. This year, we added Property Week's "Best Places to Work in Property" listing to the mantelpiece.

Mount Anvil offers a diverse rewards package which includes: Private medical insurance for you and your family through Vitality including access to our well-being scheme which offers associated discounts on spa breaks, cinema tickets, your Ocado shop, free Starbucks, Apple Watch, 50% off Virgin Active Membership and more.

We also offer you; Income Protection Insurance to help you cope financially if you're unable to work due to illness or injury, Life Assurance equivalent to four times your salary, one additional well-being day on top of your annual leave & Bank Holidays, enhanced maternity and paternity leave, an in-house Occupational Health specialist, among others.

ABOUT YOU

You'll be passionate about supporting the team and making improvements to our Finance Applications so that they can work better, faster, smarter.

Passion, enthusiasm, curiosity and the ability to build relationships inside and outside the business are imperative. You'll be a confident and clear communicator focused on providing the best service to our employees.

To succeed in this role you'll need to be a strong team player who is humble and hungry, adaptable/dynamic & flexible with the ability to thrive in a fast paced and ever-changing environment.

ABOUT THE ROLE

This is a newly created role for us, we're excited to have someone who will manage the front-end of our finance systems and continuously optimise how our people use these systems to produce financial reporting, pay suppliers and subcontractors, and staff expenses.

You'll work as part of the wider Finance team which has a great mix of experience, energy and fun – you'll learn and laugh a lot. There are a whole heap of improvements and changes we are making and want to make to our processes and systems that you'd support with.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

You'll be responsible for front-line support, system administration and process improvements which will include a review of our current systems and implementation of solutions that will optimise and improve the user experience.

You'll challenge the Finance Team to realise the potential of their systems and how they can better support the work they do.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
A strong understanding of finance systems and how data flows through systems and databases

Ability to thrive in a goal orientated environment, set stretch and challenging targets, focus on priorities, and get things done at pace
Experience working to support Finance teams in a similar role is preferred

At TrueLayer, security is at the foundation of our product. By championing the best security practices across the business, our Security Engineers empower both their colleagues and our clients, and ensure the availability, stability and security of our API platforms.

We’re looking for an ambitious Security Engineer to be our reference for all matters related to application security.

We’ll give our Security Engineers the chance to work with colleagues hailing from leading international tech companies and consultancies. They will quickly be given hands-on exposure to the latest technologies and practices and entrusted with crucial responsibilities, and will play a key part in our ambitious international expansion.

Who we are:

At TrueLayer, we’re making finance work smarter for everyone by enabling secure, global access to the financial system. Headquartered in London with offices in Milan and Hong Kong, we’ve raised $72M to date and we’re trusted by some of the biggest names in fintech, including Revolut, Chip and Zopa.

Our people are what makes us great - at TrueLayer, you will work alongside some of the brightest minds in fintech and contribute to projects that have global impact. As we enter hyper-growth and expand our open banking platform across Europe and Asia, we’re looking for talented individuals who share our core principles to join us.

Our mission is to grow the open banking economy. We’re currently the leading open banking provider in the UK, and we’re just getting started…

What you will do:
Be involved in threat modelling our services during the design phase, to ensure security is taken into account as early as possible;
Perform source code reviews of our projects;
Pro-actively test the security posture of our APIs, from an attacker’s perspective;
Help integrate application security testing into our CI/CD pipeline;
Improve and drive application security monitoring.
Requirements

We’re looking for people who:
Have multiple years of experience in application security;
Are thoroughly proficient with at least one scripting language, and one object-oriented programming language;
Have a clear understanding of modern development environments: we practice CI/CD and host everything in the cloud;
Are experienced working with Kubernetes and Docker
Can show a good understanding of the common vulnerabilities affecting modern environments;
Have good knowledge of applied cryptography;
Can demonstrate exceptional communication skills, with a talent for conveying highly technical security concepts to colleagues of technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Nice to have:
A blog, GitHub account and/or bug bounty findings that demonstrate your experience.

So, we choose to talk about Inclusion and Diversity [in that specific order] because we believe Diversity won’t be successful without Inclusion first. We build teams, cultivate leaders and create a company that’s the right fit for every person in it.

At Gearset, we build a cutting-edge DevOps solution for the millions of developers building applications on Salesforce, the world's biggest enterprise PaaS. In only a few years Gearset has become the DevOps solution of choice for some of the world's biggest companies, including IBM, McKesson, and even Salesforce themselves.

As a Gearset DevOps Engineer you will work collaboratively using a pragmatically-chosen tech stack (Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, .NET) to help Gearset run a scalable, secure and reliable service, and enable development of the solution to scale with the growth of the company. We're proud of the strong DevOps focus that we've had since starting the company but we know there is so much more that we can do to help deliver Gearset to ever larger audiences.

Joining the team you'll contribute to building out our multi-tenant infrastructure from a single region to multiple across the globe, help scale for an ever growing user base, and support a team developing an increasingly sophisticated web app utilising more and more of the power of AWS. Throughout Gearset we believe to our core in delivering value as early and as often as possibly. You'll be involved in building and maintaining the automation that allows us to do things such as release the product to our users multiple times per day, and improving how we operate across the board.
You'll be a good fit if you:
Have 5+ year of experience working in a similar role
Have in-depth practical experience working on AWS (VPC networking and security, IAM, EC2, Postgres RDS, S3, EKS)
Are well-versed in working on production infrastructure which requires maintenance with (little to) no downtime regardless of the complexity of the task
Have good knowledge of Linux
Previously have worked with infrastructure-as-code and immutable builds
Are passionate about getting your hands dirty in both supporting a growing development organization and maturing our ops
Enjoy working with a collaborative team of varied disciplines, including developers, designers, marketers and salespeople
Our ideal candidate will have experience with:
Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS EKS
Terraform
.NET/C#
Postgres
Working on a hosted, multi-tenant product
Working in an agile development team with a focus on delivering value early
Benefits:
You'll work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, in our Cambridge office
Salary is £40k - £60k, depending on experience
Bupa health care
Flexible working hours
Free lunch
Discounted gym membership, etc.

Utility Warehouse is an award winning multi-utility provider, our core offering is simple: all your utilities, one monthly bill. Our network of 45,000 partners add the human touch to our delivery, help us get the word out to our existing members and bring in new ones. We consistently win the Which? awards for our service and don’t believe “good enough” exists when it comes to customer satisfaction.

We’ve got the culture and focus of the earliest stage startups with the resources and strength of an extremely profitable and loved brand. Our eyes are on meteoric growth over the next few years. All the pieces to make it happen are here, we need you to help us put them together.

Our philosophy revolves around getting things done and we only hire people we can trust to do that. Bring your A game and you’ll always get ours. If you’re the type that can deliver you’ll be rewarded with small, fully autonomous teams that have real ownership of their products using a cutting edge stack in a best-idea-wins meritocracy. If that doesn’t quite cut it, we can throw in flexible and remote working (no, really) with top of market compensation.

As a Full Stack Engineer you will be working on graphQL backed React (+native) applications powered on apollo stack and backed by go/node grpc layer. Getting your hands dirty from the top to the bottom of the stack isn’t a promise to be broken, it’s a requirement. If you’re only good at parts of it that’s okay, we’ll quickly make you good at all of it.

As for the tech we use: the best tool is the right tool. Go and React are our bread and butter but nothing is stopping you from reaching for something else if it does it better. We deploy to Kubernetes across both AWS and GCP with some help from Terraform. We run a mature event sourced microservice architecture using Kafka, NATS and GRPC. As much as is possible we code in the open on GitHub. If it can be open- sourced, it shall. If we can submit a PR instead of building our own, we will.
What you will be doing:
Contributing to our transformational work including but not limited to billing, provisioning and in life management of telephony products and services.
Extending and refreshing our existing capabilities for our mobile, broadband, home phone and voip products
Assisting with the introduction of new telephony products and services.
Exposing a wealth of untapped data streams to power product insights and improve customer experience.
Supporting and extending our new service management, billing and provisioning platforms
